channel.title: database on RavenWare
channel.description: Recent content in database on RavenWare

item.title: Key-Value stores comparison
item.description: In this post, I will introduce the key-value store concept and compare the features of some of the well known of this kind of databases. In its essence, a key-value store can be reduced to a database containing pairs of data in the form of {key:value}. To a key, a value is associated. Let’s take some examples: “John”:"+123456789" “12-34-5678”:“Jane’s birth date” Although the notion is quite simple to grasp, implementing a key-value store, not so much.

item.title: Key-Value stores comparison
item.description: In this post, I will breakdown the main features of some key-value stores.
